Here's a command line tool you can use to search/parse this file.
https://github.com/vikstrous/pirate-get
Apparently the XML is not well formed. I will post the well-formed one afterwards (sorry guys)

Some people noticed that the XML files are not well-formed and valid. I am sorry for that, but I made perl scripts that will make them both, see https://github.com/runn1ng/pb-archive-make-valid. The script need perl, bash and sed, so you will need linux (OS X will maybe be sufficient but I have nowhere to try). I think it is better solution than uploading the file again; I am again sorry for the inconvenience.

Also - to everyone that is trying to open the file in notepad/something crazy like that - the file is NOT intended for ordinary usage instead of pirate bay. There is not point in manually searching in the XML file.

how do use this XML file? http://bvlist.com
people want to make their own tracker

Could you release this in csv format Plz!?

P.S sorry for any double posting internet being a beehotch

What would take this to another level is to recreate search capabilities of TPB offline using the archive.
Example: Search a phrase in category ebooks and sort by number of seeds.
with support for operators such as *
Not sure why but some torrents get skipped/are missing on searches that return more than 1000 results, using a TPB offline search tool would make sure I don't.
